verses.plain: Sing aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.

tokens.t: Sing aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.

verses.plain: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.

tokens.t: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.

verses.plain: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.

tokens.t: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.

verses.plain: For this was a statute for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.

tokens.t: For this
a statute for Israel,
a law of the God of Jacob.

verses.plain: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: where I heard a language that I understood not.

tokens.t: This he ordained in Joseph
a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt:
I heard a language
I understood not.

verses.plain: I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.

tokens.t: I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.

verses.plain: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.

tokens.t: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.

verses.plain: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;

tokens.t: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;

verses.plain: There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.

tokens.t: There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.

verses.plain: I am the LORD thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.

tokens.t: I
the
thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.

verses.plain: But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.

tokens.t: But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.

verses.plain: So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lust: and they walked in their own counsels.

tokens.t: So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lust:
they walked in their own counsels.

verses.plain: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!

tokens.t: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me,
Israel had walked in my ways!

verses.plain: I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.

tokens.t: I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.

verses.plain: The haters of the LORD should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.

tokens.t: The haters of the
should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.

verses.plain: He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.

tokens.t: He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.

footnotes.text: unto…: or, to the hardness of their hearts, or, imagination
submitted…: or, yielded feigned obedience: Heb. lied
